# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = split(text, "\n")
    result = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for line in lines
        if length(current_line) + length(line) <= text_width
            current_line *= line
        else
            push!(result, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
    end

    return join([current_line; result], "\n")
end

text = "This is a long sentence to demonstrate the wrapping of text based on a maximum width. The example shows how new lines are added when the length of a line exceeds the specified limit. This helps improve readability and make the content more visually appealing by breaking it into manageable chunks."
result = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(result)
```

Output:
```
This is a long sentence to demonstrate the wrapping of text based on a maximum width. The example shows how new lines are added when the length of a line exceeds the specified limit. This helps improve readability and make the content more visually appealing by breaking it into manageable chunks.
```
